Package visuals

Class BarChart

java.lang.Object
visuals.BarChart
public class BarChart extends Object
A graphical bar chart component for visualising statistics about the Chaos Game.
Author:
Mika Thein
See Also:
  • BarChart(int, int, int, int, NameFloatPair[], float)
  • paint(Graphics2D)
  • invalid @see 
    ChaosGame

  • Field Details

    • color

      public static final Color color
      The foreground color.

    • x

      public final int x
      The position and size of the bar chart component.

    • y

      public final int y
      The position and size of the bar chart component.

    • width

      public final int width
      The position and size of the bar chart component.

    • height

      public final int height
      The position and size of the bar chart component.

    • max

      public final float max
      The data magnitude that should be considered maximum. The value does not have to correspond to the actual maximum. If a data point reaches the max, the bar height reaches the height of the diagram (without padding).
      See Also:
      • data

    • data

      public final BarChart.NameFloatPair[] data
      The data. Each data point consists of a name, a magnitude and a color.
      See Also:
      • BarChart.NameFloatPair
      • max

    • BarChart

      public BarChart(int x, int y, int width, int height, BarChart.NameFloatPair[] data, float max)
      Creates a new bar chart.
      Parameters:
      x - The x position.
      y - The y position.
      width - The width in pixels.
      height - The height in pixels.
      data - The data points.
      max - The data value that should be considered maximum.
